Logger module¶

class Logger.LogLevel(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

An enumeration.

debug = 4¶
quiet = 1¶
standard = 2¶
verbose = 3¶
class Logger.PrintProgress(start, end, interval=10, label='Progress: ', _log_level=LogLevel.quiet)¶

Bases: object

Manages the printing of progress of a loop to the standard output stream. Simply initialise the object outside of the loop by defining the start and end of the loop, then call the update function every loop. e.g.:

prog = PrintProgress(0,100,interval=5,label=”Process {0} at “.format(name)) for i in range(0,100):

DoSomething() prog.update()

Version: 1.0.3 Author: Richard Grimes E-Mail: rig12@aber.ac.uk Date: 2019-06-24

formatETA(eta)¶

Return a string of an ETA given in seconds into a HH:MM:SS format.

getETA()¶

Get the ETA of finishing the process assuming a linear progression

printProgress(percentProgress, eta)¶
update(iterationsCompleted=1)¶

Call this at the end of every iteration of the loop to determine whether or not a print statement should be issued

class Logger.Runtime(label='Total runtime: ', _log_level=LogLevel.quiet)¶

Bases: object

format_time(time)¶

Return a string of an ETA given in seconds into a HH:MM:SS format.

now()¶

Returns time in seconds since the Runtime object was instantiated.

print()¶

Prints the elapsed time since the Runtime object was instantiated in a human readable form

Logger.debug(message)¶

A wrapper for Logger.log(msg, LogLevel.debug) to log messages to console with debug level severity.

Logger.init_logger(_logs_path='/home/logs/', _logs_filename='debug.log')¶
Logger.log(message, severity=LogLevel.standard)¶

Prints message to standard output if the message severity is less than or equal the current logging level. Also flushes stdout after sending to try make it work with MPI

Sunspot MLT
